title.rendered: With the most expensive tickets on their world tour, U2 performs in La Plata

content.rendered:
The Irish band U2 will perform today and tomorrow at the Ciudad de La Plata stadium, as part of a world tour launched to celebrate the 30th anniversary of their album “The Joshua Tree”, the most emblematic and successful of the group.

Tickets to see them in action are the most expensive in the world, and despite their cost they quickly sold out in June, when they went on sale via the Internet.

According to a survey carried out at the time by the Mendoza digital newspaper MDZ, the price of the Red Zone, the most exclusive VIP, which is located at the foot of the extension in the shape of the Joshua tree that has the stage, cost a little. plus $6,000, above places like Los Angeles ($4,970), London ($3,870) or Bogotá ($4,161). Meanwhile, for the General ticket, that is, the Cabecera with access to the field, the price was $2,300, a very high figure that far exceeds what is charged in Mexico City ($350), Bogotá ($1,280), London ($834) or Paris ($813) for the same location. The rest of the locations had the following prices adding the “service” charge: VIP Gold Package $5,700 (preferential with gift); Preferential Plateau $4025; Rear Seat $2875; and Platea Cabecera (without access to the field) $750.

Yesterday there were still some official tickets left for those who don’t want to pay for the resale madness. In this sense, and in the same way that happened with the match between Argentina and Peru at the Bombonera, a reseller offered a pen for $3,000 and a seat for the concert as a “gift”.

The show this Tuesday in the Buenos Aires capital is scheduled to begin at 9:00 p.m., after the English Noel Gallagher, former leader of Oasis, with his Hide Flying Birds, and the Argentine group Joystick play.

The group, whose leader Bono met yesterday at the Casa Rosada with national authorities headed by President Mauricio Macri, to whom he expressed his concern about the case of the disappeared artisan Santiago Maldonado, arrived in Argentina to appear here for the fourth time, after the recitals of 1998, 2006 and 2011.
